Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: Last week I asked about using BarterDex for OTC trading

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: James gave me some answers but unfortunately I've been too CLI challenged to succesfully test it

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: This makes my point that for normal users we need a proper simple gui for OTC trading that uses the bdex protocol

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: Is anything already planned?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: My idea is that when 2 people have agreed what they want to swap, one of them will use the gui to setup the trade selecting coins and amount

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: The gui will create a file or code to pass to the other user that will import it in his gui. The gui will then setup his side of the trade. Choosing netid and utxo splitting can be all simply done by the gui. The traders need only to deposit and proceed

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I want to offer a bounty of 25k KMD for such gui

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I can increase it if necessary

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I wonder what is the best way to proceed, I could find myself a developer

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: or if Komodo team or Chainzilla, Komodo Pioneers or other group want to take up the task, let me know

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I could make a PoC GUI for that without much hassle, but I doubt it would be very good.

Author: jorian#4555
Content: nice bounty

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Currently, you would need some backend marketmaker your could spin up in a cloud instance, with the correct firewall settings to act as the FL node, so in effect this app would not and could not be free to use, unless every person trading know how to setup the networking on his computer to create the network,

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: its a nice bounty, unfortunate most of it would be needed to fund a FR node creation machine

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: I understand, so it is harder than expected

Author: jorian#4555
Content: why would one need a backend marketmaker?

Author: jorian#4555
Content: why is a prebuilt binary in combination with electrum not feasible?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you need an unfirewalled public IP with a direct connection to internet

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: cheapest way to do that, would be to docker it an lanch it in AWS on demand, and have it time ut and die after X hours.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: not exactly expensive but has some cost

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you need a FR node to connect to

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: otherwise you would need X FR nodes run somwherre and the app chooses randomly what one to use, much cheaper to launch on demand.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: ok I'm understanding less than half of what blackjok3r says except that my idea requires a lot more work than a gui üòê

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: we are talking cents per netid not dollars... its cheap, but not free.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: someone has to pay the cost.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and cloud providers take USD... not crypto

Author: jorian#4555
Content: ah, i get what blackjoker is saying. for a new network to work, some Full Relay nodes need to be spawned in that new network to relay the alice and bob msgs?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: You only need 1, then the GUI connects alic and bob to it

Author: jorian#4555
Content: i see

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: then the user has no worries about firewalls or any of that complicated stuff

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: ‚òπ

Content: Its a large bounty, I can make a PoC, maybe for that much KMD someone else has a better idea

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: yes OTC = over the counter

Content: and what is the purpose of otc?

Content: I have work still left on scaling, if no one has attempted this I will give it a go when I am done with that.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: for when you want to swap a specific amount with a specific person

Author: jorian#4555

Author: jorian#4555
Content: can you try to work it out more and make a forum post?

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: there is a large otc market for bitcoin and other large caps, this would be a succesful app

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: there are escrow services

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I agree on its usefulness, and with its own network it *should* be very reliable

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: currently Bdex network, has too many bad bobs, makes it frustrating to use at times.

Author: KomodoWorld#8282
Content: ok I'll post this in komodo forum too

Author: jorian#4555
Content: great

Author: jorian#4555
Content: current barterdex is indeed still cumbersome at times

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I will be home in a few days, take a look at it and see if I can write down my idea in an easy to follow way, see if anyone else can improve on it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the hardest part to solve is spinnig up networks at will without knowing lots of special skills.

Author: JackLeFou#3655
Content: Hi, I was looking at notary nodes and how many blocks they mined, and I found that one of them mined a block with ~9924 KMD as reward. How can it be possible?

Author: benohanlon#1119
Content: @JackLeFou I'll take a guess it's because some centralized exchanges don't take their rewards from 5.1% and it gets sent back to the people mining... so you can play like a lottery if you're lucky getting that kind of block
